title: League Client Randomly Shuts Off Computer
body:
Hello,

I've had this issue since the beta of the new League client and I've avoided it until now by using the legacy client, but that is no longer an option. Sometimes, usually in champion select, but it has happened on the home screen, my computer will just shut off entirely. No blue screen, no message of any kind, it just shuts off and restarts itself.

It never happens in-game, only while using the client. I have already limited the problem to the new League client, (it only ever happens when the league client is open, as the focused window). It has happened a total of eleven times since the client beta some months ago. I've tried to solve the problem myself, both repairing the game and completely uninstalling and reinstalling it, but that did not solve the problem. I tried to look at the client logs, but I have no idea where to look there.

I don't know what to do at this point, any help would be appreciated.

OS: Windows 10 64-bit
CPU: Intel i7-4790K Quad Core 4.0GHz
GPU: Sapphire Vapor-X Radeon HD 7970 GHz Edition 6GB
RAM: 16GB (2x8GB) G.SKILL Ripjaws X Series DDR3 1866 F3-1866C9D-16GXM
Motherboard: GIGABYTE Z97X-Gaming 7 BIOS rv8

replies.body: I've actually had this happen to me before a few years ago, and it was because my computer's graphics card was overheating due to its fan being damaged. You may wish to have your computer checked to see if there is a problem with its fans. If they aren't working properly, you'll need to get replacement parts.

Typically shut offs like that can mean that your pc is overheating and it's restarting as a precaution, but it doesn't quite sound like the case here since it never happens **in game**. This is going to be a bit of a wall of text, but let's try a few steps to make sure your League was installed correctly and there aren't any other programs interfering with the client. 

- Uninstall LoL by going to Control Panel > Programs > Uninstall a program.

- Once it's uninstalled, download and run a free recommended utility program called [**CCleaner**](https://www.piriform.com/ccleaner)

- Delete the entire C:\Riot Games folder.

- In CCleaner, go to the Registry tab and run the Registry Cleaner to scan for any additional leftover LoL files. (I've attached a quick image for reference)
https://i.gyazo.com/89a295454e7198b77d5e9ec73a0fc8ed.png
- Click on Fix Selected Issues, back up the changes if you'd like, and click on Fix All Selected Issues.

- Restart the computer to be safe.

Hit me back up if that doesn't seem to help at all and we can dig a little further for ya!
Alright, followed these steps and will find out if it worked in due time. Last time I reinstalled the game, it took about a week to happen again.

Okay, so it just shut off again, this time in the post-match screen after a ranked game. Are there any further steps I should take?

Hmmmmm we're starting to get a little out of my territory here, and I want to make sure you get the help you deserve, go ahead and hit up our tech team in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new). They'll be able to look into your system with you much better than I'm able to here on the boards!
Having the same issue. It's been making me watch my temps like crazy but there's no change there. I think its just the client as I can run every game I play without a hitch.
Having the same problem. I play on a MacBook and the client, especially in champions select, seems to be very buggy. It freezes, it lags and it makes my MacBook restart himself.

Look up where to find your Windows crash logs, and download BlueScreenView (it just parses out the dump file to make it easier to read and get info from). It gives you the driver filename and some more info that caused the crash.
This is very helpful to program devs, and sometimes even a google search with that info can lead to some answers.
I am having the same issue as well. Been in a support ticket for about a week and still no fix :(
